keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and STANLEY REED

lead_paragraph: Although the deal would lower global output by less than 1 percent, it is the first time in eight years the cartel has said it would reduce production.

headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Rise 5% on OPEC’s Tentative Deal to Cut Production
headline.main: OPEC Agrees to Cut Production, Sending Oil Prices Soaring

snippet: Although the deal would lower global output by less than 1 percent, it is the first time in eight years the cartel has said it would reduce production....
abstract: OPEC's 14 oil producing nations agree to modestly reduce their collective oil production later in 2016 in attempt to strengthen dropping prices; move sends global oil prices rising by over 5 percent.
